feed.title: Houlahan Lab
feed.subtitle: The Houlahan lab integrates large-scale, diverse tumour multi-omic data with statistical and machine learning models to uncover signal of germline-mediated selection pressures on the tumour phenotype.

entry.title: The Houlahan Lab supports the Bright Run

link.title: The Houlahan Lab supports the Bright Run

entry.content: The Houlahan Lab is now supported by the Bright Run Foundation (see here for more details). To give back, we participated in the 5km run through Christie Lake Conservation Area. In collaboration with the Daniel lab, we raised over $15,000 for breast cancer research!
entry.summary: The Houlahan Lab is now supported by the Bright Run Foundation (see here for more details). To give back, we participated in the 5km run through Christie Lake Conservation Area. In collaboration with the Daniel lab, we raised over $15,000 for breast cancer research!

entry.title: New Master’s student - Erika Apel
entry.content: The Houlahan lab welcomes our first graduate student. Erika Apel joined the lab as a Master’s student. Erika will be studying how inherited DNA variants influence the mutational profile of glioblastoma. Welcome Erika!
entry.summary: The Houlahan lab welcomes our first graduate student. Erika Apel joined the lab as a Master’s student. Erika will be studying how inherited DNA variants influence the mutational profile of glioblastoma. Welcome Erika!

entry.title: Katie appointed Canada Research Chair, Tier 2 in Computational Oncology

link.title: Katie appointed Canada Research Chair, Tier 2 in Computational Oncology

entry.content: Katie was appointed a Canada Research Chair, Tier 2 in Computational Oncology.
entry.summary: Katie was appointed a Canada Research Chair, Tier 2 in Computational Oncology.

entry.title: Katie selected as Gairdner Early Career Investigator

link.title: Katie selected as Gairdner Early Career Investigator

entry.content: Katie was selected as a winner of the 2024 Gairdner Early Career Investigator award. The Gairdner ECI competition invites promising Canadian researchers to submit an application to present their research as part of Gairdner Science Week events in October. Katie was selected from among the field of applicants by the 2024 recipients of the Canada Gairdner International Award, who are being recognized for their work developing next generation sequencing technology. Watch Katie’s talk at the Gairdner International Symposium.
